content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 267.4 - Records of employers and other persons required to file returns of information

State Regulations
(a) Every
employer or withholding agent, as defined for Federal withholding tax purposes, required under Part 269 of this Title to deduct and withhold City of Yonkers
earnings tax upon the wages of employees, and every person required to file a
return of information, must keep all records pertinent to withholding of City
of Yonkers earnings tax and returns of information available for examination
and inspection by the State Tax Commission or its authorized representatives. Records with respect to City of Yonkers earnings tax withheld must be retained
for a period of four years after the due date of the City of Yonkers earnings
tax withheld for the return period to which the records relate, or the date the

City of Yonkers earnings tax withheld was paid, whichever is later. Records
with respect to City of Yonkers returns of information must be retained for a
period of four years after the due date of the return of information. (b) No particular form is prescribed for the
keeping of records of employers and other persons required to file returns of
information. However, in the case of employers, the records should include the
amounts and dates of all wage payments subject to City of Yonkers earnings tax, the names, addresses and occupations of employees receiving such payments, the
periods of their employment, the periods for which they are paid by the
employer while absent due to sickness or personal injuries and the amount and
weekly rate of such payments, their social security account numbers, their
withholding exemption certificates, the employer's identification number, record of City of Yonkers employer withholding returns and reports filed, and
the dates and amounts of City of Yonkers earnings tax withholding payments
made. For those nonresident employees performing services partly within and
partly without the City of Yonkers, a record of the allocation used for City of

Yonkers withholding purposes must also be kept. Notes
